definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Barrows grow faster because the young boars can be castrated earlier.
sentences.chinese: 由於小公豬可早一些去勢，所以閹過以後長得更快。

sentences.english: The day of growth inflection point is puberty.
sentences.chinese: 睾丸的拐點日齡和公豬的初情期接近。

sentences.english: Do not house gilts near stimulus boar.
sentences.chinese: 小母豬舍不應接近刺激用的公豬。

sentences.english: Piggery managers keep records of sow and boar performance in a book or computer program.
sentences.chinese: 豬場管理員會把母豬和公豬記錄在本上或者電腦裏。

sentences.english: Use v. boars to simplify the process.
sentences.chinese: 利用輸精管結紮的公豬，可使過程簡單化。

sentences.english: While the boars rush into combat, the sows stay protected in their fortresses.
sentences.chinese: 公豬湧向戰場，母豬被守護在堡壘裏。

sentences.english: The BLUP is a better method in estimating breeding value of boar.
sentences.chinese: 估測青年公豬的育種值，用BLUP法比較好。

sentences.english: All the other male pigs on the farm were porkers.
sentences.chinese: 莊園裏其他的公豬都是食用豬。

sentences.english: Buha by the go, just want to die and come to a boar's.
sentences.chinese: 布哈依這次去，就是想和公豬來個同歸於盡的。

sentences.english: Is it a turkey or a boar or something else?
sentences.chinese: 土耳其是一個或公豬還是什麼？

sentences.english: Clan boars are the married boars, respected due to their wife's income.
sentences.chinese: 氏族公豬，是已婚的公豬，地位依賴妻子的收入而定。

sentences.english: Clan boars are the married boars, respected due to their wife's income.
sentences.chinese: 氏族公豬，是已婚的公豬，地位依賴妻子的收入而定。

sentences.english: This method can be a reasonable use of boar.
sentences.chinese: 這種方法能合理地使用公豬。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
